topic.title: Presenting Validation Errors in JSON Documents

body.p: Validation errors in JSON documents are presented in various locations of the interface.

section.title: Validation Marker Locations
section.p:
Validation issues are marked in the following locations:
In the main editing pane, with the issue underlined in a color according to the type of issue.
In the right-side vertical stripe, with a marker that is colored according to the type of issue.

section.title: Validation Markers in the Right-Side Stripe
Hovering Over Validation Issues
section.p: Hovering over a validation issue presents a tooltip message with more details about the problem. Also, when hovering over an issue, pressing F2 will change the focus to the tooltip.

ul.li: Information about the issue is also displayed in the message area on the bottom of the editor panel (clicking the Document checking options button opens the Document Checking preferences page where you can configure some validation options (such as the colors used to present the validation issues).

li.ph: If you want to see all the validation messages grouped in the Results panelview, you should use the Validate action from the toolbar or Document Validate JSON menu. This action also collects the validation messages and displays them in the Problems view if the validated file is in the current workspace or in a custom Errors view if the validated file is outside the workspace.
